Home.title: Home
Home.home_goals: I will one day be a frontend developer and work fulltime with creative and exciting projects.
Home.home_quote: When I was little, my imaginary friend used to play with the kid across the street.

About.title: About
About.about_content_1: My name is Erik, and I am a curious and focused individual currently learning front-end development through KodeHode. I enjoy working in the IT field and find design and functionality fascinating. In my personal life, I am a Jack of All Trades, engaging in various activities such as music, photography, gaming, dog ownership, and mechanical work on cars, among others.
About.about_content_2: I have knowledge across multiple fields, but primarily, I have worked extensively with HTML, CSS, Photoshop, and web design. I have also worked with Wordpress to a considerable extent.
About.about_title_3: WHERE do I want to go
About.about_content_3: In the future, I envision myself working with design and functionality in the context of website or application development. I also aim to enhance my back-end skills with the intention of becoming a full-stack developer.

project_RNG.name: Random Number Generator
project_RNG.description: An application designed to produce random numbers when the user clicks a button, with the ability to highlight those numbers based on type.
project_RNG.goals: I was tasked with using the Javascript we had just learned to create something, and I really liked the random math logic in Javascript and all the fun ways I could implement it. I also wanted to see how I could sort and target the results, and let the user manipulate those results visually.
project_RNG.challenges: Some of the biggest challenges in the Javascript aspect of the project was handling the numbers when creating the logic, as I needed to be aware of the difference between strings and numbers. The CSS also proved to be a bit challenging when handling the logic for displaying the results.
project_RNG.reflection: This project became sort of my Javascript baby as I worked quite a bit with it, polishing and improving it.

project_MRS.name: Mars, the red planet
project_MRS.description: A website dedicated to the planet Mars and our exploration of it.
project_MRS.goals: We were tasked with creating a website for a planet, and my group was assigned the planert Mars. We had to implement the HTML and CSS we had learned so far, as well as be able to create Flex- and Grid-based framework. The website had to be a non-responsive design.
project_MRS.challenges: The biggest challenge for me on this project was to chose what ideas to implement into the site, and which ideas to scrap. I had many creative moments where I needed to reign myself in as to not make the project to complex for my partner to participate in the coding. Luckily, we found common ground fast and decided that I would take charge of the design aspect, and she would work on sourcing and placing the text content.
project_MRS.reflection: This was a fun project to do, especially when I started on the color-scheme. I quickly fell in love with custom CSS variables during this task.

project_DPD.name: Retro Drumpad
project_DPD.description: An application that simulates an old MIDI drumpad, with playable light-up pads and a volume slider.

project_DGD.name: Dogfood Calculator
project_DGD.description: An application I made for the Norwegian dogfood brand LABB, that lets the customers calculate how much dogfood they should feed their dog each day.

project_NFD.name: Article Newsfeed
project_NFD.description: A website made for the display of news articles, with the ability to sort and favourite them.

project_CLC.name: Simple React Calculator
project_CLC.description: A simple calculator application with the ability to change color-themes.
